1.title: US Presidential Election 2024
1.description: In her closing address at the Democratic National Convention, Vice President Kamala Harris rebuked Donald Trump, urging optimism and faith. She emphasised the need for Palestinian representation, supported Israel's right to defend itself, and resonated with gun violence survivors’ calls for action.
1.content: In a powerful closing address at the Democratic National Convention, Vice President Kamala Harris accepted her party's nomination, strongly rebuking former President Donald Trump while urging American... [3135 symbols]
1.summary: In a closing speech at the Democratic National Convention, Vice President Kamala Harris accepted her party's nomination and emphasised the importance of the upcoming election, condemning former President Donald Trump's actions and warning of the dangers posed by a president without accountability. She also highlighted the chaos of Trump's presidency and the consequences of his actions. Despite calls for a Palestinian American speaker, the convention ended without representation, leading to significant backlash. In her speech, Harris emphasised her commitment to Israel and advocated for Palestinian self-determination, while also advocating for a resolution that ensures security for Israel and dignity for the Palestinian people. She concluded her speech with a message of hope, stating that "it is now our turn to do what generations before us have done, guided by optimism and faith, to fight for this country we love."

4.summary: More than a dozen Republicans have declared they are running for president in 2024, in an increasingly crowded field of contenders vying for their party's nomination for the White House. Among them are DeSantis, a 44-year-old Florida governor, Hurd, and several long-shot candidates. Former governor of New Jersey Christie has had a tumultuous relationship with Trump, who was tapped to run his transition team after an apparent dispute with Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner, and has positioned himself as a tough-talking candidate who is willing to go after Trump in a way other candidates will not. Other candidates have entered the presidential race with little national name recognition but the deep pockets required to run a major campaign.

6.title: 2024 US Presidential Election: Asian Implications
6.description: The 2024 US presidential election will have major implications for the Asian countries, as they face challenges and opportunities from China, trade, security, and climate change.
6.content:
The 2024 US presidential election, scheduled for November 5, 2024, will be a pivotal moment for the future of the US and its relations with the world.

The election will pit incumbent President Joe Bi... [3616 symbols]
6.summary: The 2024 US presidential election will be a pivotal moment for the future of the US and its relations with the world. The election will pit incumbent President Joe Biden against former President Donald Trump, who is seeking to reclaim the White House after being impeached twice and facing multiple criminal charges. Issues such as the economy, pandemic, climate change, immigration, health care, and national security will influence the election. The focus will be on the US foreign policy, especially towards Asia, which is a region of vital importance and strategic competition for the US. The US-China rivalry, which has intensified under the Trump and Biden administrations, will also be a central theme of the election, with the US-India partnership also a key focus. The elections will determine whether the US will continue to confront and contain China, or seek to cooperate and coexist.

9.title: 2024 US Presidential Election: Who won the presidential debate?
9.description: As the debate reverberates across social media, the diverse opinions highlight the polarized nature of this election cycle, setting the stage for further political discourse. Watch exclusive on India Today Global.
9.content: The presidential debate hosted by ABC showcased a dynamic face-off between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris, as they clashed on many critical topics. While the debate itself did not officially declare a... [1361 symbols]
9.summary: The presidential debate hosted by ABC on September 10, which did not officially declare a winner, sparked intense reactions and discussions across social media platforms. As the debate ended, social media users shared their opinions on who they think won the debate. The interviews and polls conducted by India Today Global indicate that Kamala Harris was ahead of Donald Trump, while some polls indicated that Trump won by a significant margin. CNN's instant polls also indicated that Harris was the winner, with 63 percent of respondents believing she won the debates. The differing perspectives on who performed better highlighted the polarized climate of this election as both candidates continue to campaign. The impact of this debate will likely influence voter perceptions and the trajectory of the race.

10.title: US Election 2024: What If Trump Wins Presidential Election?
10.description: If Trump wins the election, his unchecked ambitions could lead to severe authoritarian shifts in U.S. policy, including harsh immigration measures, expanded executive power, and retribution against opponents.
10.content:
US Election 2024: What If Trump Wins Presidential Election?

In his second year in office, Trump repeatedly called for mass executions of gang members and drug lords, obsessing over the idea of firing... [5041 symbols]
10.summary: If Donald Trump wins the US Presidential Election in 2024, his unchecked tendencies could have severe consequences for American democracy if he wins. His second term could see a shift towards authoritarianism, with plans including draconian immigration policies, massive deportations, reinstating the Muslim travel ban, and reshaping energy policy to favour fossil fuels. His approach to regain power is largely motivated by his desire to avoid prison and avoid legal issues. He has been convicted on 34 felony counts related to a hush-money cover-up and facing federal charges related to election interference and a Georgia indictment, and views regaining the White House as a way to abuse power and interfere with his criminal cases. His plans for a second term also include a radical approach to immigration, promising mass deportations of undocumented immigrants. His administration is expected to use broad executive powers to implement these policies, potentially leading to significant constitutional and humanitarian issues. His rhetoric suggests a desire to undermine democratic norms and potentially subvert election processes by challenging constitutional limits.

7.1.summary: Uncertainty and anxiety are looming over the 2024 US presidential election after former President Donald Trump was projected to easily win the first major test of the 2024 Republican primary race. This victory is seen as a boost for Trump's momentum towards a potential rematch with current Democratic President Joe Biden. David Redlawsk, James R. Soles professor and chair, Department of Political Science and International Relations, University of Delaware, said that Trump has significant control of Republican primary voters and elites, making him the only possible candidate to beat Biden. There are efforts to remove Trump from the ballot in several states, including Colorado's Supreme Court and Maine's Secretary of State Sheena Bellows. However, Trump has dismissed these efforts as political attacks.

8.1.summary: CBS late-night host Stephen Colbert has become a major shill for the Democratic Party, once hailed as a fearless satirist who spoke truth to power. Since taking over "The Late Show" on CBS in 2015, Colbert has increasingly praised Democrats and aligns with the liberal media line. He hosted a conversation with Democratic presidents Joe Biden, Barack Obama, and Bill Clinton at a record-setting fundraiser in New York City that raised $26 million for Biden's 2024 presidential campaign. The event was part of a record setting fundraiser. Critics question why Colbert's involvement in this type of political shillism is tolerated in the US, given his lack of comedy skills and lack of knowledge of the party.

10.1.content: Betting on the outcome of elections across the world has been a part of the culture in many countries for decades, but it hasn’t been a regular part of American betting culture to date. And with the e... [2929 symbols]
10.1.summary:
Betting on the outcome of elections across the world has been a part of the culture in many countries for decades, but it hasn’t been a regular part of American betting culture to date. 

But while it is illegal to bet on the outcome of elections using regulated sports betting apps and vendors in the United States, that doesn’t mean it hasn’t been happening behind closed doors forever. But there are ways to get more action via betting on individual states, the margin of victory, and other markets created by both sites. 

The province of Ontario in Canada has recently legalized betting on elections in the United States, and the other 12 provinces will have the option to do so as well.

The most recent polls show that the incumbent president is vulnerable with an approval rate hovering around 40%, and Americans don't have any enthusiasm for a revival of the 2020 duel between Joe Biden and Donald Trump. Joe Biden’s chances seem to depend on some key issues like the state of the economy, the impact of his balance sheet, his age and his ability to force the ballot box issue in November 2024. The ongoing debate in Congress over the debt ceiling does nothing to build confidence, and many observers note that Joe Biden has significant economic, environmental and social successes under his belt. Despite this, the highly polarized political climate is not helping to publicize the benefits of the Biden administration. In 2024, Joe Biden will have to articulate his vision and order to make it to make the ballot ballot box.

1.4.summary: Rap star Eminem has formally asked Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy to stop rapping his campaign songs, according to a letter released Monday. The American organization for the protection of musical rights, BMI, indicated in a missive that it had received “an official request” from Eminem demanding that the thirty-something candidate not use his music more. During the last two presidential elections, several renowned artists, including Pharrell Williams, Rihanna, Aerosmith or Adele, as well as the heirs of Prince, had complained that their titles were played at Donald Trump campaign rallies. Rolling Stones had even threatened the Republican with legal action if he continued to use their hit You Can't Always Get What You Want.

2.4.title: US Presidential Election
2.4.description: Trump's Super Tuesday win puts him on track for the GOP nomination. Facing criminal charges, his presidential bid hinges on legal outcomes, with potential courtroom disruptions in the near term.
2.4.content:
Or is it?

While Trump might currently be the red-hot favourite for a third run for presidency with no major opponents left in the primary race, he has other obstacles in his way.

Over the past few m... [3592 symbols]
2.4.summary: The outcome of the US presidential election depends on the outcome of four criminal cases, both civil and criminal, which could determine whether or not Trump will run for president. If found guilty in either of the four cases, Trump could face jail time and potentially end his presidential bid. The hush money trial, in which Trump is accused of paying $130,000 to porn star Stormy Daniels, could also pose a significant issue. However, the only impact the criminal cases will have on Trump's candidacy is that they require him to attend court hearings and could impact his time on the campaign trail. The US Constitution does not explicitly prohibit convicted felons from holding the position of president, and there is no procedure to officially nominate an alternative candidate. If Trump wins the Republican party nomination, the GOP lacks a procedure to formally nominate an alternate candidate.

Betting on elections still isn’t allowed at U.S. sportsbooks. But we’re allowed to it in Canada,” said DraftKings sportsbook director Johnny Avello, who is based in Las Vegas. “On the Democratic side, President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris are both going backwards in bettors’ 2024 estimations.”

The largest obstacle to the approval of election betting in Nevada is the state legislature. In 2014, then-state Sen. Greg Brower, R-Reno, said: “Frankly, I think that something as important as elections, as opposed to games, should not be the subject of wagering in our state.”

U.S. bookmakers would love to take action on the election.

“We’ve talked to people around the world,” Westgate SuperBook vice president Jay Kornegay said. “The books that offer it say it outhandles the Super Bowl 10 times over.

Trump Announces Candidacy for 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Former US President Donald Trump Is going to announce on Tuesday that he will "run for president" in 2024, one of his close advisers confirmed. 

Trump had hinted earlier about the possibility of his candidacy again, saying that he would make a "big announcement" from his residence in Florida, which in recent days no longer aroused much excitement, especially after rumors circulated about his preparations to run the race to the White House again. 

"President Trump will announce on Tuesday that he is a presidential candidate," Trump adviser Jason Miller said on the Wardroom podcast, which is presented by another friend of the former Republican president, Steve Bannon.

Former president Donald Trump has announced he ... [8136 symbols]
10.4.summary:
The path to the 2024 US presidential election begins almost as soon as midterm elections end - and several candidates are already waiting in the wings.

Former president Donald Trump has announced he will run for the party's nominating contest, vowing to "make America great and glorious again".

But while he remains popular with Republican voters, an underwhelming midterm performance, due in part to losses for Trump-endorsed candidates, has left him more vulnerable.

The ex-president, who will be 78 in two years, is likely to face a stiff challenge from a coterie of Republican hopefuls, including some who once backed him. Nikki Haley announced her bid for the presidency in Mid-February, becoming the first major Republican candidate to commit to taking on Mr Trump. Mr Pence, 63, is a born-again evangelical Christian and his addition to the 2016 presidential ticket is credited with helping turn out evangelicals, a crucial voting bloc, for Mr Trump. The two have kept their distance since then, with Mr Pence endorsing several Republican candidates during the 2021 midterm elections, including Georgia Governor Brian Kemp, whose opponent Mr Trump backed.

He formally announced his bid in April, telling voters that he needs more time to finish his job. However, many Democrats have expressed concerns about his age, mental acuity, and challenges ahead. His approval ratings have also dropped to the lowest of his tenure among Democrats. Minnesota Congressman Dean Phillips filed a long-shot bid for the nomination in October after calling on Biden to step aside for months. Social justice activist Marianne Williamson was the first Democrat to enter the 2024 race, with a formal campaign launch in March. Her policy platform includes universal government-run healthcare, free childcare, at least $1tn in slavery reparations to black Americans and a federal agency called the Department of Peace. progressive political commentator Cenk Uygur's candidacy could face challenges as he was born in Turkey, making him ineligible under the Constitution to run for the presidency.

His support stands at 51% among Republicans, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted from Sept. 8 through Sept. 14. Florida Gov. DeSantis, who is close to Trump's top rival, has positioned himself to the right of Trump on key social issues such as abortion. Other candidates include former South Carolina governor Haley, former New Jersey governor Christie, and Ramaswamy, a former biotechnology investor and executive, who started a company in 2022 to pressure firms to abandon environmental, social, and corporate governance initiatives.

1.5.summary: President Joe Biden and his predecessor, Donald Trump, are expected to dominate the 2024 US presidential election, with key battlegrounds expected to be Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. Each state holds its own vote for the next commander-in-chief, and candidates are awarded "electors" from each state according to its size. With candidates needing 270 electors to win the White House, elections tend to be decided in "swing states" with a history of alternating between Republican and Democratic candidates. However, Trump now leads opinion polling averages in all six. In Georgia, prosecutors have indicted Trump in an election interference case after he urged state officials to "find" enough votes to overturn Biden's 2020 victory. Meanwhile, Biden risks losing the support of a 200,000-strong Arab-American community over his handling of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

Despite this, Biden's support for Vice President Kamala Harris, who was involved in all major decisions during his term, was immediately supported by the Democratic Party. Harris has since transformed herself from being a lackluster vice president to an energetic candidate with infectious enthusiasm. 7.8.summary: The Republican candidate for the US Presidential elections in November has denied allegations of his connections to 'Project 2025', an ultra-conservative playbook created by a group of conservatives as a plan for his second term in office. The Heritage Foundation, a conservative American think tank, published Project 2025 as a blueprint for the 2025 Presidential Transition. The project was established in 2022 and has been working on several changes to economic and social policies to make the federal government and its agencies more conservative. The team that created the project has 140 former Trump staffers, including its director Paul Dans, who was chief of staff at the Office of Personnel Management while Trump was president. While many Republicans have downplayed or distanced themselves from Project 2025, Democrats have played it up in the election campaign.

9.7.description: Professor Allan Jay Lichtman has made his predictions for the 2024 elections, declaring Kamala Harris as the first female president of the US, breaking new ground as a leader of both South Asian and African American heritage. Watch the exclusive on India Today Global.
9.7.content: In an exclusive interview with India Today Global, Professor Allan Jay Lichtman, known as the "Nostradamus of US. elections," shared his valuable insights with Geeta Mohan about the upcoming 2024 US. ... [8182 symbols]
9.7.summary: Professor Allan Jay Lichtman, known as the "Nostradamus of US elections", has revealed his predictions for the 2024 US presidential election. His "Keys to the White House" model uses 13 criteria to determine whether the incumbent party's presidential candidate is likely to win or lose the next election. These criteria include party mandate, contest, no serious primary contest for the incumbent's nomination, no major third-party or independent campaigns, and no major scandals. Lichtmen's predictions have been widely criticised by academics and academics, but he insists his methods work on an administration-by-administration basis. He also addressed criticism of Kamala Harris, predicting her as the first woman president of South Asian and African American origin or first Indian and black woman.

1.6.summary: Arthur Sinodinos, a long-term client and friend of ABL's managing partner in Sydney Paul Rubenstein, has delivered a comprehensive analysis of the 2024 US Presidential Election. He highlighted the importance of the Trump/Harris election, describing it as "the most compelling and consequential in a very long time" and highlighted the implications for Australia and the world of each of the two victory scenarios. Sinodino, who served as ambassador from the final year of the Donald Trump presidency to March last year and previously as a senior government minister in the federal parliament, provided an analysis of both candidates' campaign strategies and the implications of each victory scenario.

The US Presidential Election will take place on 5 November 2024.

10.8.summary:
2024: Again, Donald Trump bid for US presidential election. 

Former United States President, Donald Trump, Tuesday announced his intention to run for the White House once again in the 2024 presidential election. 

In a speech at Mar-a-Lago, Trump said that from the moment he left office almost two years ago, speculation was rife that he intended to return.

“I am tonight announcing my candidacy for president of the United States. 

“For millions of Americans, the two years under Joe Biden have been a time of pain, hardship and despair.
